In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is how you could define such a function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end
```

Here is an example:

```julia
s = "This is a very long string. It contains many words and it may exceed the maximum width."
println(wrap_string(s))
```

In this example, the output will be:

```
This is a 
very long 
string. It 
contains many 
words and it 
may exceed 
the maximum 
width.
```
